intro: Drynaria adfinis, commonly known as the Philippine tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical forests. Its rhizome system is robust, allowing it to anchor firmly in moist, well-drained soil. The fronds are evergreen and can grow up to several meters in length, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
